page.title: 07Living in Eastoft
page.content: I get up about 8am and get washed, dressed and go downstairs for breakfast. I often go out riding on my bike, it is very peaceful in Eastoft. The land around is used to grow cereal crops and sugar beet. Many of the farms are very big but there are still a few small ones. When we reach 11 we have to go school in Crowle and travel each day by bus. The population of the village is about 300 which makes it a small place. We have a Post Office, a church, a Village Hall and a primary school. There used to be fish in some of the streams around here but many have died, probably as a result of pollution.
